name: Tachyon, New ZK Open source library for all of us
description:
Our L2 network, Kroma(Optimistic Rollup), uses a zkEVM for a fault proof. At this moment, the proof generation time is slow and expensive. In order to make it faster and cheaper, we decide to accelerate it with GPU.
This talk gives audiences with a brief introduction to why we decided to build another zk open source library from scratch and how it differs from others.

speakers.name: Ryan Kim
speakers.bio:
- Kroma, I'm a C++ specialist.
- Robot S/W Engineer @ NaverLabs
- Browser S/W Enginner @ Samsung Research Center
- Defcon Finalist
